Identification.LongTitle: Court of Queen’s Bench for Saskatchewan Summary Conviction Appeal Rules

Provision.Text: The annexed Rules were made by the Court of Queen’s Bench for Saskatchewan pursuant to section 482a of the Criminal Codeb and section 28 of the Queen’s Bench Act, 1998c.

SignatureTitle.Emphasis: Court of Queen’s Bench for Saskatchewan

Section.Text: In these Rules,

Definition.Text: appeal means an appeal from a summary conviction court under Part XXVII of the Criminal Code, R.S.C. 1985, c. C-46, and The Summary Offences Procedure Act, 1990, S.S. 1990-91, c. S-63.1, as amended from time to time; (appel)
appeal court means the Court of Queen’s Bench for Saskatchewan; (tribunal d’appel)

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a municipality,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Meewasin Valley Authority,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Wakamow Valley Authority,

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the Wascana Centre Authority,

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the University of Regina, or

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the University of Saskatchewan; (autorité)

Definition.Text: file means file with a local registrar; (déposer)
Form mean a Form as set out in the Appendix to these Rules; (formule)
judge means a judge of the appeal court; (juge)
local registrar includes a deputy local registrar of the appeal court; (registraire local)

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to an appeal in respect of an offence under the Criminal Code, a prosecutor as defined in section 2 of the Criminal Code;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to an appeal in respect of an offence under an Act of Saskatchewan or a regulation made pursuant to an Act of Saskatchewan, the following persons, including counsel or an agent acting on behalf of any of them:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the Attorney General for Saskatchewan, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the Attorney General for Saskatchewan does not intervene, the informant or person who issued the ticket for the offence;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to an appeal in respect of an offence under an Act of the Parliament of Canada or a regulation made pursuant to an Act of the Parliament of Canada, the following persons, including counsel or an agent acting on behalf of any of them:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the Attorney General of Canada, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the Attorney General of Canada does not intervene, the informant or person who issued the ticket for the offence;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to an appeal in respect of a bylaw of an authority, the authority and includes anyone authorized by the authority to prosecute bylaws on its behalf. (poursuivant)

Subsection.Text: A defendant who commences an appeal shall file with the local registrar nearest to the place where the decision was made a Notice of Appeal in Form 1 in accordance with the instructions on that form.

The defendant shall commence the appeal under this Rule within 30 days after the pronouncement of the order under appeal, or within 30 days after the imposition of sentence if a sentence has been imposed, whichever is later.
The defendant shall state their address for service on the Notice of Appeal, including

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their telephone number; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, their fax number and email address.

Subsection.Text: After filing a Notice of Appeal, the defendant shall notify the local registrar in writing of any change to that information.
Filing of the Notice of Appeal with the local registrar constitutes service on the prosecutor.
The local registrar shall forward a copy of the Notice of Appeal to the prosecutor.

A prosecutor who commences an appeal shall file with the local registrar nearest to the place where the decision was made a Notice of Appeal in Form 2 in accordance with the instructions on that form.

The prosecutor shall commence the appeal under this Rule within 30 days after the pronouncement of the order under appeal, or within 30 days after the imposition of sentence if a sentence has been imposed, whichever is later.
The prosecutor shall state their address for service on the Notice of Appeal, including

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their telephone number; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, their fax number and email address.

Subsection.Text: The prosecutor shall serve the defendant with the Notice of Appeal not later than 10 days after it is filed with the local registrar.
The prosecutor shall serve the Notice of Appeal and any other document required to be served on the defendant by personal service.
The prosecutor shall file proof of service with the local registrar.

If the prosecutor is unable to serve the Notice of Appeal or any other document that is required to be served on the defendant personally, the prosecutor may apply ex parte to a judge of the appeal court for an order to serve the defendant in the manner that the appeal court directs.

If the prosecutor serves the Notice of Appeal or any other document that is required to be served in accordance with an order for substituted service, the defendant is deemed to have been served with that document.
On the application of the defendant or prosecutor, the appeal court may:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: set aside or vary an order for substituted service as the appeal court considers just; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: make any order respecting service of either or both of the Notice of Appeal and any other document.

Section.Text: After the Notice of Appeal has been filed, the local registrar shall obtain the material provided for in subsection 821(1) of the Criminal Code from the summary conviction court.

Subsection.Text: Within 14 days after serving the Notice of Appeal, the appellant shall furnish to the local registrar proof, satisfactory to the local registrar, that transcripts of the trial proceedings have been ordered.
Subrule (1) does not apply if the appellant has applied under Rule 8 for a trial de novo.

Section.Text: Unless the appeal court otherwise orders, or an agreed statement of facts has been filed pursuant to subsection 830(2) of the Criminal Code, the appellant shall, within 10 days after receipt of the transcript,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the appeal is against an order other than sentence,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the original and one copy of the transcript of evidence, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the reasons for judgment from the summary conviction court, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: serve one copy of the transcript of evidence and the reasons for judgment on the respondent;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the appeal is against sentence,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the transcript of evidence, if any, of the sentencing proceedings, including the submissions of the prosecution and the defence as to sentence, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: serve one copy of the transcript of evidence mentioned in clause (i)(A) and the reasons for sentence on the respondent; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the appeal is against both sentence and an order other than sentence, file and serve on the respondent the material mentioned in paragraphs (a) and (b) within 10 days after receipt of the transcript.

Subsection.Text: An appellant who applies for a trial de novo under subsection 822(4) of the Criminal Code shall submit a Notice of Application to the appeal court within 30 days after serving the Notice of Appeal.
At least seven days before the hearing of the application, the appellant shall serve a copy of the Notice of Application and any supporting material on the respondent.

Section.MarginalNote: Date, time and place of hearing

Subsection.Text: The appellant is not required to state a date, time or place for the hearing of the appeal in a Notice of Appeal.

On receipt of the material required to be transmitted by the summary conviction court pursuant to subsection 821(1) of the Criminal Code and a transcript of the evidence, unless dispensed with by order of the appeal court, the local registrar shall set a date, time and place for the hearing of the appeal.

Section.MarginalNote: Notice of date, time and place of hearing
Section.Text: As soon as the appeal is set for hearing, the local registrar of the appeal court shall give notice to the appellant and to the respondent that the appeal has been set down for hearing as well as notice of the date and time when, and the place where, the appeal will be heard.
Unless the appeal court otherwise orders, the appellant and respondent shall each file a memorandum of argument with the local registrar.
The appellant’s memorandum of argument shall be in Form 3 and shall contain the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: Part 1 Introduction: The appellant’s brief summary of the context for the appeal;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: Part 2 Jurisdiction and Standard of Review: The appellant shall state its position on each of the following matters:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the source of the right of appeal;

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the jurisdiction of the court to determine the appeal; and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the applicable standard of appellate review;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: Part 3 Summary of Facts: The appellant shall concisely state the facts;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: Part 4 Points in Issue: The appellant shall concisely state the points in issue in the appeal;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: Part 5 Argument: The appellant’s argument setting out precisely the points of law or fact to be argued and the basis for the argument, with reference to the page and line of the transcript and the authorities relied on in support of each point. Any statute, regulation, rule, ordinance, bylaw or part thereof relied upon shall be copied as an appendix to the memorandum or separately filed;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: Part 6 Relief: The precise order the appellant desires the court to make;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: Part 7 Authorities: A table of authorities relied upon by the appellant, arranged alphabetically. Citations shall be done in compliance with the Citation Guide for the Courts of Saskatchewan.

Section.Text: The respondent’s memorandum of argument shall be in Form 4 and shall contain the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: Part 1 Introduction: The respondent’s brief summary of the context for the appeal;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: Part 2 Jurisdiction and Standard of Review: The respondent shall state its position on each of the following matters:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the source of the right of appeal;

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the jurisdiction of the court to determine the appeal; and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the applicable standard of appellate review;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: Part 3 Summary of Facts: The respondent shall concisely accept, modify or supplement the appellant’s statement of facts as required;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: Part 4 Points in Issue: The respondent shall accept or respond to each point in issue raised in the appellant’s memorandum and add such additional points as it wishes to raise. The respondent shall state any intentions and the reasons to argue the judgment should be upheld, in whole or in part, for reasons not found in the judgment and not raised in the appellant’s memorandum;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: Part 5 Argument: The respondent’s argument, setting out concisely the points of law or fact to be argued and the basis for the argument, with reference to the page and line of the transcript and the authorities relied on in support of each point. Any statute, regulation, rule, ordinance, bylaw or part thereof relied upon shall be copied as an appendix to the memorandum or separately filed;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: Part 6 Relief: The precise order the respondent desires the court to make; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: Part 7 Authorities: A table of authorities relied upon by the respondent, arranged alphabetically. Citations shall be done in compliance with the Citation Guide for the Courts of Saskatchewan.

Section.Text: At least 30 days before the date set for the hearing of the appeal, the appellant shall file their memorandum of argument and serve a copy on the respondent.
At least 15 days before the date set for the hearing of the appeal, the respondent shall file their memorandum of argument and serve a copy on the appellant.

Subsection.Text: The respondent may apply to the appeal court for an order that the appeal be dismissed if the appellant fails to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: pursue the appeal diligently; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: comply with these Rules.

Subsection.Text: The respondent shall serve the appellant with 14 days’ notice of the date, time and place of the hearing of the application.

Section.Text: If the local registrar considers that the appellant has not pursued the appeal diligently or has not complied with these Rules, the local registrar may refer the matter to the appeal court.

If the local registrar makes a reference under Rule 17, the local registrar shall serve the appellant and the respondent with 14 days’ notice of the date, time and place of the hearing of the reference, by mailing the notice to each party’s address for service.
On an application under Rule 16 or a reference under Rule 17, the appeal court may dismiss the appeal or make any other order it considers just.

Section.MarginalNote: Power of court if appellant fails to file memorandum or to appear
Section.Text: If an appellant fails to file a memorandum of argument as required by Rule 14 and fails to appear at the hearing on the date and at the time and place set out in the notice given by the local registrar under Rule 10, the appeal court may dismiss the appeal or make any other order it considers just.
An appellant may abandon an appeal by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: signing and filing a notice in Form 5; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: informing the appeal court in person or by counsel that the appeal is abandoned.

Section.Text: Any judge may, on application, extend or shorten the time provided for the giving of any notice or the doing of any act, even if an application for extension or an order granting an extension is made after the time has expired.
An appellant who applies for release, a stay of a probation order, a stay of a driving prohibition, or any other stay order, shall file with the local registrar

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a Notice of Application in Form 6;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an affidavit verifying the facts on which the appellant relies in support of the application; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any other material on which the appellant relies in support of the application.

Section.Text: On filing an application under Rule 23, the appellant shall serve the application and accompanying material on the prosecutor.
If an appellant applies pursuant to Rule 23, the local registrar shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: within three days after receiving the material from the appellant, set a date for the hearing of the application; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: notify the appellant and the respondent of the date and time when, and the place where, the hearing will be held.

Section.MarginalNote: When appeal court may make orders re application without prosecutor
Section.Text: With the written consent of the prosecutor, the appeal court may make any order on an application pursuant to Rule 23 without the attendance of the prosecutor.

Section.MarginalNote: General procedure and practice of appeal court to be followed
Section.Text: Unless provided otherwise by statute or by these Rules, the general procedure and practice of the appeal court shall be applied, with necessary modification, in a summary conviction appeal, including an application to dismiss an appeal and an application for release or stay.
[Repeal]
These Rules come into effect on April 1, 2011.

Provision.Text: IN THE COURT OF QUEEN’S BENCH
both the conviction entered and the sentence imposed;

TitleText.Emphasis: Information About the Conviction and/or Sentence Under Appeal:

Provision.Text: Name of Presiding Judge or Justice in Summary Conviction Court
Date on which the Conviction was Entered
Description of Conviction Entered (state fully offence(s) on which convicted)
Date on which the Sentence was Imposed

Text.Emphasis: (set out briefly the basis of the Appeal)
(set out briefly what order the Appellant is seeking)

Provision.Text: will be represented by a lawyer on the Appeal; or
will not be represented by a lawyer on the Appeal.
The Appellant wishes to present the Appeal:
by oral presentation and by memorandum of argument.
The Appellant’s address for service is:

Text.Emphasis: (include telephone number, email address and fax number if applicable)

Provision.Text: DATED at , Saskatchewan, this day of , 20.
TO: The Local Registrar of the Judicial Centre of

Text.Emphasis: fax number and email address of appellant

Provision.Text: IN THE COURT OF QUEEN’S BENCH
both the dismissal order made and the sentence imposed;

TitleText.Emphasis: Information About the Conviction and/or Sentence Under Appeal:

Provision.Text: Name of Presiding Judge or Justice in Summary Conviction Court
Date on which the Order was Made

Text.Emphasis: (complete if Appeal relates to order or dismissal order)
(if dismissal order, state fully the offence or offences charged in the information dismissed)

Provision.Text: Date on which the Sentence was Imposed

Text.Emphasis: (complete if Appeal relates to sentence imposed)
(set out briefly the basis of the Appeal)
(set out briefly what order the Appellant is seeking)

Provision.Text: The Appellant wishes to present the Appeal:
by oral presentation and by memorandum of argument.
The Appellant’s address for service is:
(include telephone number, email address and fax number if applicable).
DATED at , Saskatchewan, this day of , 20.
AND TO: The Local Registrar of the Judicial Centre of

Text.Emphasis: fax number and email address of appellant)

Provision.Text: IN THE COURT OF QUEEN’S BENCH
DATED at , Saskatchewan, this day of 20.
TO: The Local Registrar of the Judicial Centre of

SignatureBlock.SignatureName: (name, address, telephone number, fax number and email address of appellant or appellant’s lawyer)

Provision.Text: IN THE COURT OF QUEEN’S BENCH
DATED at , Saskatchewan, this day of 20.
TO: The Local Registrar of the Judicial Centre of

SignatureBlock.SignatureName: (name, address, telephone number, fax number and email address of respondent or respondents lawyer)

Provision.Text: IN THE COURT OF QUEEN’S BENCH
THE APPELLANT hereby abandons this appeal.
DATED at , Saskatchewan, this day of , 20.
[if this document is signed by the Appellant, the attached Affidavit of Execution must also be completed]
This notice was signed by the Appellant in the presence of:
TO: The Local Registrar of the Judicial Centre of

Text.Emphasis: fax number and email address of appellant

Provision.Text: I, , of , in the Province of , MAKE OATH AND SAY:

That I was personally present and did see , the Appellant named in the Notice of Abandonment, who is personally known to me to be the person named in it, duly sign and execute the Notice of Abandonment;
That the Notice was executed at , in the Province of and that I am a subscribing witness to it;
That I know the said and he/she is in my belief eighteen years of age or more.
SWORN BEFORE ME AT in the Province of Saskatchewan, this day of , 20 .

SignatureBlock.SignatureTitle: In and for the Province of Saskatchewan.

Provision.Text: IN THE COURT OF QUEEN’S BENCH
TAKE NOTICE that the Appellant will make an application at the Court House, Judicial Centre of , Saskatchewan, at a date and time to be set by the Local Registrar, for an Order that:

Text.Emphasis: (check one or more of the following)

Provision.Text: the appellant be released from custody;
the probation order in this matter be stayed; or
the driving prohibition in this matter be stayed pending the determination of the Appellant’s Appeal.

Text.Emphasis: (if the appellant seeks an order other than one mentioned above, the appellant must here set out the nature of the stay order sought)

Provision.Text: AND TAKE NOTICE that the application will be made on the following grounds:
AND FURTHER TAKE NOTICE that in support of the said application will be read this Notice of Application, Affidavit of and proof of service where necessary, all filed.
DATED at , Saskatchewan, this day of , 20.
TO: The Local Registrar of the Judicial Centre of

Text.Emphasis: fax number and email address of appellant
